headline: Pennsylvania American Water Receives More than $9.5 Million in PENNVEST Funding for Lead Service Line Removal Project in New Castle
summary: MECHANICSBURG, Pa., April 23, 2025--The Shapiro administration today announced that Pennsylvania American Water was awarded a grant and a low-interest loan from the Pennsylvania Infrastructure Investment Authority (PENNVEST) totaling $9,527,990. The funding will support one of the company’s lead service line replacement projects in the City of New Castle, Lawrence County.

headline: Illinois American Water Proudly Recognizes American Water Charitable Foundation 2025 Water and Environment Grantees
summary: BELLEVILLE, Ill., April 23, 2025--Illinois American Water recognizes 11 organizations across the state as American Water Charitable Foundation 2025 Water and Environment Grantees.

headline: New Jersey American Water Announces New Vice President of Business Development, Government Affairs and External Affairs
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., April 23, 2025--New Jersey American Water is pleased to announce that Kimberly Schalek Downes has joined the company this month as Vice President of Business Development, Government Affairs and External Affairs. In this role, Schalek Downes will lead the company’s strategic outreach, legislative engagement, and growth efforts across the state. She will oversee the Business Development, Government Affairs, and External Affairs teams, reporting directly to the company president.

headline: Missouri American Water Proudly Recognizes American Water Charitable Foundation 2025 Water and Environment Grantees
summary: ST. LOUIS, April 23, 2025--The American Water Charitable Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organization established by American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., recently announced four organizations were awarded a 2025 Water and Environment grant, supporting communities served by Missouri American Water.
